title: 107_s880
content: The "Immunosuppressive Drug Coverage Act of 2001" ensures appropriate coverage of immunosuppressive drugs under the Medicare program. The "Immunosuppressive Drug Coverage Act of 2001" ensures continued entitlement to immunosuppressive drugs for kidney transplant recipients under the Medicare program. The "Immunosuppressive Drug Coverage Act of 2001" requires individuals to pay the full part B premium to receive coverage for drugs, subject to deductibles and coinsurance. Inpatients of hospitals are entitled to coverage under part B. Procedures are established to implement the Act. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will establish procedures to identify beneficiaries entitled to coverage of immunosuppressive drugs and distinguish them from those enrolled under part B of title XVIII. Additionally, a technical amendment redesignates subsection (c) of section 226A as subsection (d). The Social Security Act is amended to extend Secondary Payer Requirements for ESRD beneficiaries regarding immunosuppressive drugs without time limitations. The effective date for these amendments applies to drugs furnished after the enactment of the Act. SEC. 2707 of the Public Health Service Act requires health insurance coverage to include immunosuppressive drugs. The Immunosuppressive Drug Coverage Act of 2001 mandates group health plans to provide comprehensive coverage for immunosuppressive drugs. Additionally, a conforming amendment to the Public Health Service Act ensures the incorporation of this requirement. This applies to group health plans and group health insurance coverage under the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974. The Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 is amended to include a new section. SEC. 714. COVERAGE OF IMMUNOSUPPRESSIVE DRUGS. The Immunosuppressive Drug Coverage Act of 2001 requires group health plans to provide coverage for immunosuppressive drugs that is as comprehensive as before the enactment. Amendments are made to the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 to incorporate this requirement. The Immunosuppressive Drug Coverage Act of 2001 mandates group health plans to cover immunosuppressive drugs comprehensively. Amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 ensure this coverage. The Immunosuppressive Drug Coverage Act of 2001 requires group health plans to provide coverage for immunosuppressive drugs that is as comprehensive as before the enactment of the Act. This requirement is effective for plan years starting on or after January 1, 2002.
